document_data.mainbody:
Nells Pie Shop was a small bakery business operated by Nell Kirschtorte out of her home in Liams Hold circa 1372 DR.
Nells humble home was located in the north-western part of Liams Hold, right by a well, overlooking the Trade Way.
Nell Kirschtorte spent most of her time toiling over hot ovens in her home, churning up fresh breads, pies, and other pastries. The Pie Shops specialty were elderflower-soaked black and red cherry pies, dried fruit-stuffed eccles cakes, and honey-dipped toffee apples. She also sold pre-made sheets of filo pastry dough.
